Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka hope to end World Cup duck against Pakistan, having never beaten them in ODI World Cups with a 0-7 record.
Both teams have played one game in this World Cup, with Pakistan winning against Netherlands and Sri Lanka losing to South Africa.
Pakistan's middle order has shown improvement, while their openers have struggled.
Haris Rauf's performance with the ball has been a positive for Pakistan.
Sri Lanka's bowling performance against South Africa was poor, but they showed resilience in their batting.
The pitch in Hyderabad has been batting-friendly, with high scores expected.
The weather forecast predicts partly cloudy skies with no rain expected.
Pakistan's head coach Grant Bradburn highlighted the improved performance of the middle order despite concerns about the top order.
Sri Lanka's assistant coach Naveed Nawaz mentioned the familiarity between the teams due to recent matches in the Asia Cup.
Grant Bradburn expressed confidence in Pakistan's top order despite their recent struggles.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad has been familiar to Pakistan, having played three games there recently.
Sri Lanka's spinners have been the most productive among all teams since 2022, while Pakistan's spinners have struggled.
Imam-ul-Haq is close to reaching 3000 ODI runs, needing just nine more runs.
Sri Lanka's Charith Asalanka has been a key middle-overs batter, with impressive statistics since his ODI debut.
